Fulltimate Custom Night

It's all the characters becoming hostilities! You need to survive until six in the morning!

Introduction

‚ÄúYou are Mike Schmitty, and you are hired to keep watch of the Fulltimate Servos Company complex. The objects in the complex are very varied, from plain white lowercase letters to killer animatronics‚Ä¶ and a furry. Your job is to take note of their behavior (not what you do in game) and survive until six in the morning (this is what you do in game).

The company doesn‚Äôt want to spend much money on paying electricity bills, so a mere full charge from a power supply is the only thing that can keep this place up and running. The job also requires you to be flexible and fast, so good luck.‚Äù



What is Fulltimate Custom Night?

Fulltimate Custom Night is a FNAF fangame, specifically of Ultimate Custom Night. It requires the skills to be flexible, fast, and observant. This game is a combination of Starmapo‚Äôs Paint‚Äôs Ultimate Custom Night and KamilFirma‚Äôs Ultra Custom Night. The twist here is the fact that it‚Äôs just not FNAF characters, it‚Äôs literally any character in existence. It is known for its abundant number of characters, its fullness of everybody, great music, ambitious collaborators, and unique characteristics.

Fulltimate Custom Night was created with love, care, and ambition in December 11, 2023 from a desire to make a custom night game with a custom roster of characters pickable from the developers and fans. Original FNAF characters like Freddy Fazbear and Toy Bonnie are kept in the roster as well as internet memes such as Amogus and Morgan Freeman. The developers get to have their OCs in the game too, with UN4YA the Cube, interseer the Angry Russian, or just a recolored Mario. Fulltimate Custom Night is where all cultures meet within a survival horror-like game made on a coding website for kids.



Timeline

December 10, 2023

Discord group chat made, invited UN4YA, interseer, zxcks2x, and tartarsauce as developers.

December 11, 2023

Fulltimate Custom Night is launch to Scratch, with the publication of FCN's first ever official version, v0.0.1.

December 17, 2023

Newbular joins as official composer for the game, making tracks such as "My Life Be Like" and "Goofy Ahh Menu".

April 8, 2024

beepybunny joins as official asset finder for the game, becoming one of the most valuable members.

April 14, 2024

The v0.2.1 variant of Fulltimate Custom Night was launched to Game Jolt.

August 26, 2024

Mariopuff's original Discord account made in April 16, 2021 was hacked. A new group chat for suggestions was made.

September 2, 2024

The new group chat focused on the claim-a-square activity within the game's roster spreadsheet.

November 2024

The group finally starts focusing on developing the game.

December 11, 2024

One year anniversary of Fulltimate Custom Night's launch to Scratch!!

February 1, 2025

DefinitelyDinkey joined the developers as a senior artist. In the same day, CzarIsActual joined as a thumbnail maker and playtester.

March 22, 2025

kaecyro._xynn joins the FCN team.

April 26, 2025

Fulltimate Custom Night hits 80 characters in its roster!! üéâüéâ

Fun fact: FCN has a planned character limit of 320 total characters. This means that 25% of all planned characters have actually been coded into Scratch!

Developers & Collaborators

Here are some introductory words from Fulltimate Custom Night‚Äôs developers and collaborators‚Ä¶

mariopuff [founder, game owner, chief coder]

That‚Äôs me! I am techically the founder and current owner of Fulltimate Custom Night. I consider this project the most work and effort one I have put in among all the others. Besides FCN, I‚Äôm planning to code a WarioWare-esque game called MICROGAMING, a spot-the-anomaly game called ALTERING NIGHT-SHIFTS, and another FNAF fangame called Two Weeks at Momo‚Äôs. I account for like 75% of the game‚Äôs making, but I wholeheartedly value all of my team‚Äôs contributions to FCN too :)

UN4YA [senior producer]

‚ÄúHello! I am from Earth.. obviously. More specifically, I am a mildly autistic, mildly insane teenager from Bangladesh. I consider myself quite the nerd. I also consider myself a wildcard; one day I can be cooking up some of the most insane shit FCN has seen and the other I‚Äôm literally doing absolutely nothing. That being said, I think I am quite the competitive person. As for my contributions to FCN‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs not THAT much. Then again I have been described as ‚Äúslightly brutally honest‚Äô before. To the game itself, I‚Äôve only really contributed a couple dozen character ideas. However, I have made most of the ‚Äúinfrastructure‚Äù (I guess you could call it that) for the spreadsheet, mostly on the statistical side of things, as well as styling. I guess I‚Äôm the spreadsheet guy. Oh and music guy. I do music too. I make ridiculously long tracks‚Ä¶ for some reason that I don‚Äôt know, and that nobody ever will. I personally consider myself a fast producer; I did cook up a nearly 5-minute long track in 20 minutes that one time, and I have made a 45-minute track too. If I can make a track longer than 10 minutes, I probably will. I consider myself pretty productive in that regard. I don‚Äôt know what else to say; I‚Äôm kinda bad at interviews. As for Fulltimate Custom Night, in my opinion, I really like what it has become, and to think that it could still be built on and improved massively, really gets me excited about what it will soon become. It is truly an honour to be in the developer team of this game, even if I haven‚Äôt contributed THAT much to the game itself.‚Äù ‚Äì UN4YA 2025

interseer (formerly 4unduck) [concept designer, junior coder, junior producer]

‚ÄúHi there! I‚Äôm a random person from this planet, as you may have assumed. Well, all of my work for FCN can be characterised by one quote: ‚ÄúIt ain‚Äôt much, but it‚Äôs honest work‚Äù. I‚Äôm here more for ideas, suggestions, improvements, etc. For example, a lot of the office UI has my concept art or ideas in it. I also used my ancient Scratch skills to help the Man, Mario, code the thermometer shake. I adore what Fulltimate Custom Night has become, and when I look at game footage and see stuff I know I suggested, it always sparks a little bit of joy in me. I don‚Äôt really take this stuff very seriously though, I‚Äôm only here because I have a lot of free time and nothing else to do.‚Äù ‚Äì interseer 2025

SeftBunnY [chief artist]

SeftBunnY serves as the chief artist of the team, known for their laid-back, slightly chaotic, and candid vibe. They radiate a mix of dry humor, blunt honesty, and occasional soft moments‚Äîcalling someone a ‚Äúcutie patootie‚Äù in one message and exclaiming ‚Äúgay men‚Äù or ‚Äúew?‚Äù in another. A PC gamer and VRChat enthusiast with a broken M key, they casually share pirated game links, guitar riffs, and random thoughts with a mix of lowercase typing and bursts of keyboard chaos. Whether venting about Clip Studio Paint, practicing ‚ÄúCreep‚Äù on acoustic guitar, or reacting to absurd Discord antics, Seft balances irreverence with creative energy, often disappearing mid-convo with a simple ‚Äúim out.‚Äù

DefinitelyDinkey [senior artist]

DefinitelyDinkey is the senior artist of the group, bringing a wild and creative energy to every project they touch. As a furry artist who embraces any pronouns, they‚Äôre the type to drop unexpected gems like ‚ÄúPUSSY‚Äù and ‚ÄúFLINT AND STEEL üó£Ô∏èüî•‚Äù while also being the one to dig into complicated gameplay, artwork, and school struggles with equal passion. Whether they‚Äôre sharing their journey of learning to draw realistic portraits or ranting about their biology exam, Dinkey adds a dynamic, chaotic vibe to every conversation. Their artistic flair and unpredictable nature make them a key player in the team, always ready to create something new ‚Äî and just as likely to drop a meme at any moment.

beepybunny [game ripper]

beepybunny is a dedicated and passionate game ripper who thrives on the adrenaline of intense gaming sessions and the challenge of uncovering hidden details within complex FNAF fangames. His approach to the game mirrors that of a competitive racer ‚Äî focused, determined, and always pushing himself to get the most out of every task. Beepy often takes a deep dive into the game‚Äôs mechanics, dissecting every element and exploring character backstories, lore, and hidden secrets. His passion for these details can sometimes lead to moments of frustration when things don‚Äôt go as planned, and when this happens, he‚Äôs known to blow up. He‚Äôll unleash a flurry of frustration on anyone or anything standing in his way. But it‚Äôs this intense drive that fuels his creativity and dedication. Whether he‚Äôs passionately discussing gameplay strategies or defending the integrity of a particular character‚Äôs arc, Beepy brings an undeniable energy to every conversation. His fiery enthusiasm, while occasionally leading to these outbursts, is exactly what pushes him to excel in everything he does. He‚Äôs the kind of person who will pour hours into a game, looking for the perfect way to break it down and share his findings with the team. And despite the occasional blowup, Beepy‚Äôs contributions are always invaluable, pushing the team to greater heights with every detail he uncovers.

‚ÄúHi :) I am Czar, I do stuff I guess. What I do in FCN is make some designs for the game, and actually playtest the game as well. zxcks2x

zxcks2x, casually called Issac, is a laid-back, easygoing individual with a strong Roblox presence and a knack for creating chill vibes. A fan of both gaming and pop culture, he enjoys engaging with his friends, often sharing funny moments or thoughts that reflect his relaxed personality. Whether discussing random ideas or just enjoying the Minecraft movie, Isaac is all about the low-pressure fun. He stands out not just for his gaming skills but for his vibrant, lighthearted approach to life, which shows in his playful, witty exchanges. His involvement in the racing community, particularly with the Subminimal Subway crew, highlights his versatility and passion for the things he enjoys.

‚ÄúHello! I am the game ripper. Ripping games is kind of my thing. I‚Äôve only slightly contributed to Fulltimate Custom Night, but I‚Äôve worked together with mariopuff in his previous games. I‚Äôve been friends with mariopuff for a while. I am also working on a few other projects, but I am pretty inactive online. That‚Äôs all, I guess.. I mean it‚Äôs not like you‚Äôll read all of this anyway.‚Äù ‚Äì itznero (aka tartarsauce) 2025



Goals & Motivation

Fulltimate Custom Night started as a small Discord collaboration and grew into a massive creative project planned to involve over 300 characters, along with a lot of game mechanics, and lore contributions. We wanted to celebrate our community‚Äôs humor, energy, and FNAF fandom by building a wild, customizable night experience. With our strong team of ambitious developers and fans, I, as the father of FCN, am looking foward to a path to stardom for Fulltimate Custom Night and its franchise.



Features & Functionality

‚Äì Loads of playable characters with unique mechanics
‚Äì Doors, camera lights, vents, mask, elevator, desk cassette tape & more
‚Äì Custom tablet interface with chat logs, hallucination resets, and node fixes
‚Äì Chaotic & comedic energy blended with strategy and lore



Reflection

Working on Fulltimate Custom Night has really taught me a lot of lessons about team management and leadership. I realized how effective and fun working as team is. I also learned over time the great value of my friends‚Äô contributions to the project, and from that I am really thankful to my collaborators and fellow developers for making my biggest custom night game project come true!
